pullRequest.title: refactor: Refactor of events tracker importer
pullRequest.bodyText:
Design document presentation: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ep51m6HgGqcnHHXR0Uot3nrVYBrxmy1zJ8iWSrackJY/edit?usp=sharing
The goal of this PR is to increase performances of the POST /api/events endpoint. The performance goal is to reach 100 req/sec with 100 concurrent users (assuming capable hardware and latency). Additionally, the refactor aims at modularizing the Event import code, for better readability and testability.
The design takes also in consideration back-portability.
Significant changes in the Event Importer architecture:

Introduced an EventImporter class that is responsible for encapsulating the Import logic (this class is invoked by the AbstractEventService - which has been significantly simplified
Introduced a WorkContext that is responsible to pre-load all the data required for the validation and additional processing. The WorkContext uses Jdbc to load data using the lowest number of query possible. The WorkContext life-span is limited to the import event, even though Program data is cached for a minute.
Introduced a "PreProcessing" pipeline. Pre processors are responsible for adding required data to the incoming Events (for instance, resolving the Event's ProgramInstance)
Introduced a validation Pipeline. Events validation rules have been split in smaller classes, which are executed in sequence. The goal is to avoid hitting the database during validation, but only used the data accumulated in the WorkContext
Introduced a "PostProcessing" pipeline. Post processors are responisble to execute actions such as Program Rules or Audit
Events persistence is now using Jdbc (as opposed to Hibernate). The events are persisted using batched Jdbc statements for additional performance gain
Transaction handling has been redesigned to incorporate the concept of "retries". When a batch of events is saved transactionally, if one or more events fail to persist, the system rolls-back the transaction, and re-process one event at the time in its own transaction, so that the "failing" events can be isolated and reported back
Improved the test coverage with unit tests and e2e tests (@vilkg)
